description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1uuf8","text":"We present here a protocol for preparing liposomes that can be used to monitor binding of proteins to vesicles of various membrane curvatures.  We used this to study the association of the PPM1H phosphatase with highly curved membranes due to its N-terminal amphipathic helix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 120, e2219953120 (2023)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":117,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c204h","text":"All  lipids were purchased from Avanti Polar Lipids. PC and PS were obtained as 10mg/ml\nchloroform solutions. PI, PI(4)P and cholesterol sulfate were obtained as powders. Dissolve in chloroform to prepare 2mg/ml, 1mg/ml and 25mg/ml stock solutions respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78cj","text":"Prepare unilamellar vesicles by mixing:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h945","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af7u6","text":"  of (18:0-20:4)PC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhmlf","text":"  of (18:0-20:4)PI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8tmkk","text":"  of (18:0-18:2)PS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"at0vv","text":"  of (18:1)PI(4)P","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7k54h","text":"  of cholesterol sulfate ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b6rqu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n0bu","text":"from the respective stock solutions in a glass vial. The lipid composition of the liposomes is in the ratio (mol %) 78:7:5:1:9 to represent the mammalian cell Golgi composition (Fasimoye et al., 2023).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"940","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"470","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"140","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"26","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctcvr","text":"Dry the above-mentioned lipid mixture in chloroform under nitrogen flow by pointing a Pasteur pipette into the glass vial. This vial is subsequently incubated under house vacuum for at least  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":191,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aq22c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"efde9","text":"Resuspend the dried lipids by pipetting up and down in 1ml of resuspension buffer (50mM HEPES pH 7.5, 120mM KCl)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rlci","text":"Sonicate the liposome suspension by two brief   cycles of bath sonication followed by sequential extrusion through 0.4, 0.1 and 0.05 µm pore size polycarbonate filters for 21 times using a hand extruder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"94iu0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ekje","text":"The final lipid concentration of the liposome suspension will be 15mM;  store at   for a maximum of 2 weeks.  Small liposomes are best used close to the time of their preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":81,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"tbu6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

title: Preparation of unilamellar liposomes
